00032     "CREATE TABLE ....... Creates a table",

00034     "DESCRIBE TABLE ..... Displays a table's schema",
00035     "DROP TABLE ......... Removes a table",
00036     "INSERT ............. Inserts data into a table",
00037     "LOAD DATA INFILE ... Loads data from a tab delimited input file into a table",
00038     "SELECT ............. Selects (and display) cells from a table",
00039     "SHOW CREATE TABLE .. Displays CREATE TABLE command used to create table",
00040     "SHOW TABLES ........ Displays the list of tables",
00041     "",

00043     "a specific statement, type 'help <statement>', where <statement> is one from",
00044     "the preceeding list.",

00069   const char *help_text_create_scanner[] = {
00070     "",
00071     "CREATE SCANNER ON range_spec",
00072     "    [where_clause]",
00073     "    [options_spec]",
00074     "",
00075     "range_spec:",
00076     "    table_name '[' [start_row] \"..\" ( end_row | ?? ) ']'",
00077     "",
00078     "where_clause:",
00079     "    WHERE where_predicate [ && where_predicate ... ] ",
00080     "",
00081     "where_predicate: ",
00082     "    ROW = row_key",
00083     "    | ROW > row_key",
00084     "    | ROW >= row_key",
00085     "    | ROW < row_key",
00086     "    | ROW <= row_key",
00087     "    | ROW STARTS WITH substr",
00088     "    | TIMESTAMP >  timestamp",
00089     "    | TIMESTAMP >= timestamp",
00090     "    | TIMESTAMP <  timestamp",
00091     "    | TIMESTAMP <= timestamp",
00092     "",
00093     "options_spec:",
00094     "    ( MAX_VERSIONS = version_count",
00095     "    | LIMIT = row_count",
00096     "    | INTO FILE 'file_name'",
00097     "    | DISPLAY_TIMESTAMPS",
00098     "    | RETURN_DELETES",
00099     "    | KEYS_ONLY )*",
00100     "",
00101     "timestamp:",
00102     "    'YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS[.nanoseconds]'",
00103     "",
00104     "NOTES:  If the start_row is absent from a range_spec, it means NULL or",
00105     "the beginning of the range.  If the end_row is specified as ??, then it",
00106     "will get converted to 0xff 0xff which indicates the end of the range.",
00107     "",
00108     "Example:",
00109     "",
00110     "  CREATE SCANNER ON Test[..??]",
00111     "",
00112     (const char *)0
00113   };

00154     "UPDATE table_name input_file",
00155     "",

00158     "lines that illustrate the format of this file:",
00159     "",
00160     "1189631331826108        acaleph DELETE",
00161     "1189631331826202        acrostolion     apple:http://www.baseball.com/       Vilia miretur vulgus",
00162     "1189631331826211        acerin  banana:http://sports.espn.go.com/       DELETE",

00167     "",
00168     "The string \"DELETE\" has special meaning.  In the first example line",
00169     "above, it generates a 'delete row' for the row key 'acaleph'.  In the",
00170     "third example line above, it generates a 'delete cell' for the column",
00171     "'banana:http://sports.espn.go.com/' of row 'acerin'.",
00172     "",

00413   const char *help_text_delete[] = {
00414     "",
00415     "DELETE Syntax",
00416     "",
00417     "  DELETE ( '*' | column_key [ ',' column_key ...] )",
00418     "    FROM table_name",
00419     "    WHERE ROW '=' row_key",
00420     "    [ TIMESTAMP timestamp ]",
00421     "",
00422     "  column_key:",
00423     "    column_family [ ':' column_qualifier ]",
00424     "",
00425     "  timestamp:",
00426     "    'YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS[.nanoseconds]'",
00427     "",
00428     "The DELETE command provides a way to delete cells from a row in a table.",
00429     "The command applies to a single row only and can be used to delete, for",
00430     "a given row, all of the cells in a qualified column, all the cells in a",
00431     "column family, or all of the cells in the row.  An example of each",
00432     "type of delete is shown below.  Assume that we're starting with a table",
00433     "that contains the following:",
00434     "",
00435     "hypertable> SELECT * FROM CrawlDb;",
00436     "2008-01-28 11:42:27.550602004   org.hypertable.www      status-code     200",
00437     "2008-01-28 11:42:27.534581004   org.hypertable.www      status-code     200",
00438     "2008-01-28 11:42:27.550602002   org.hypertable.www      anchor:http://www.news.com/     Hypertable",
00439     "2008-01-28 11:42:27.534581002   org.hypertable.www      anchor:http://www.news.com/     Hypertable",
00440     "2008-01-28 11:42:27.550602001   org.hypertable.www      anchor:http://www.opensource.org/       Hypertable.org",
00441     "2008-01-28 11:42:27.534581001   org.hypertable.www      anchor:http://www.opensource.org/       Hypertable.org",
00442     "2008-01-28 11:42:27.550602003   org.hypertable.www      checksum        822828699",
00443     "2008-01-28 11:42:27.534581003   org.hypertable.www      checksum        2921728",
00444     "",
00445     "The first example shows how to delete the cells in the column",
00446     "'anchor:http://www.opensource.org/' of the row 'org.hypertable.www'.",
00447     "",
00448     "hypertable> DELETE \"anchor:http://www.opensource.org/\" FROM CrawlDb WHERE ROW = 'org.hypertable.www';",
00449     "",
00450     "hypertable> select * from CrawlDb;",
00451     "2008-01-28 11:42:27.550602004   org.hypertable.www      status-code     200",
00452     "2008-01-28 11:42:27.534581004   org.hypertable.www      status-code     200",
00453     "2008-01-28 11:42:27.550602002   org.hypertable.www      anchor:http://www.news.com/     Hypertable",
00454     "2008-01-28 11:42:27.534581002   org.hypertable.www      anchor:http://www.news.com/     Hypertable",
00455     "2008-01-28 11:42:27.550602003   org.hypertable.www      checksum        822828699",
00456     "2008-01-28 11:42:27.534581003   org.hypertable.www      checksum        2921728",
00457     "",
00458     "The next example shows how to delete all of the cells in the column",
00459     "family 'checksum' of the row 'org.hypertable.www'.",
00460     "",
00461     "hypertable> DELETE checksum FROM CrawlDb WHERE ROW = \"org.hypertable.www\";",
00462     "",
00463     "hypertable> select * from CrawlDb;",
00464     "2008-01-28 11:42:27.550602004   org.hypertable.www      status-code     200",
00465     "2008-01-28 11:42:27.534581004   org.hypertable.www      status-code     200",
00466     "2008-01-28 11:42:27.550602002   org.hypertable.www      anchor:http://www.news.com/     Hypertable",
00467     "2008-01-28 11:42:27.534581002   org.hypertable.www      anchor:http://www.news.com/     Hypertable",
00468     "",
00469     "And finaly, here's how to delete all of the cells in the row 'org.hypertable.www'.",
00470     "",
00471     "hypertable> DELETE * FROM CrawlDb WHERE ROW = \"org.hypertable.www\";",

00504   typedef hash_map<std::string, const char **>  HelpTextMapT;
00505 
00506   HelpTextMapT &buildHelpTextMap() {
00507     HelpTextMapT *map = new HelpTextMapT();
00508     (*map)[""] = help_text_contents;
00509     (*map)["contents"] = help_text_contents;
00510     (*map)["create table"] = help_text_create_table;
00511     (*map)["delete"] = help_text_delete;
00512     (*map)["insert"] = help_text_insert;
00513     (*map)["select"] = help_text_select;
00514     (*map)["describe table"] = help_text_describe_table;
00515     (*map)["describe"] = help_text_describe_table;
00516     (*map)["show create table"] = help_text_show_create_table;
00517     (*map)["show create"] = help_text_show_create_table;
00518     (*map)["load data infile"] = help_text_load_data_infile;
00519     (*map)["load data"] = help_text_load_data_infile;
00520     (*map)["load"] = help_text_load_data_infile;
00521     (*map)["show tables"] = help_text_show_tables;
00522     (*map)["drop"] = help_text_drop_table;
00523     (*map)["drop table"] = help_text_drop_table;
00524     return *map;
00525   }
00526 
00527   HelpTextMapT &textMap = buildHelpTextMap();
00528 }
00529 
00530 
00531 const char **HqlHelpText::Get(const char *subject) {
00532   HelpTextMapT::const_iterator iter = textMap.find(subject);
00533   if (iter == textMap.end())
00534     return 0;
00535   return (*iter).second;
00536 }
00537 
00538 
00539 const char **HqlHelpText::Get(std::string &subject) {
00540   HelpTextMapT::const_iterator iter = textMap.find(subject);
00541   if (iter == textMap.end())
00542     return 0;
00543   return (*iter).second;
00544 }
00545 
00546 
00547 void HqlHelpText::install_range_server_client_text() {
00548   textMap[""] = help_text_rsclient_contents;
00549   textMap["contents"] = help_text_rsclient_contents;
00550   textMap["select"] = help_text_select;
00551   textMap["create"] = help_text_create_scanner;
00552   textMap["create scanner"] = help_text_create_scanner;
00553   textMap["destroy"] = help_text_destroy_scanner;
00554   textMap["destroy scanner"] = help_text_destroy_scanner;
00555   textMap["drop range"] = help_text_drop_range;
00556   textMap["fetch"] = help_text_fetch_scanblock;
00557   textMap["fetch scanblock"] = help_text_fetch_scanblock;
00558   textMap["load"] = help_text_load_range;
00559   textMap["load range"] = help_text_load_range;
00560   textMap["update"] = help_text_update;
00561   textMap["replay start"] = help_text_replay_start;
00562   textMap["replay log"] = help_text_replay_log;
00563   textMap["replay commit"] = help_text_replay_commit;
00564   textMap["shutdown"] = help_text_shutdown;
00565 }
